1: -module(ct_telnet_timetrap_SUITE).
    2: 
    3: -compile(export_all).
    4: 
    5: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    6: 
    7: -define(name, telnet_server_conn1).
    8: 
    9: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   10: %% TEST SERVER CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   11: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   12: 
   13: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   14:     Config.
   15: 
   16: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   17:     ok.
   18: 
   19: suite() -> [{require,?name,{unix,[telnet]}},
   20: 	    {require,ct_conn_log},
   21:  	    {ct_hooks, [{cth_conn_log,[]}]},
   22: 	    {timetrap,{seconds,7}}].
   23: 
   24: all() ->
   25:     [expect_timetrap,
   26:      expect_success].
   27: 
   28: groups() ->
   29:     [].
   30: 
   31: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   32:     Config.
   33: 
   34: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   35:     Config.
   36: 
   37: init_per_testcase(_,Config) ->
   38:     ct:log("init_per_testcase: opening telnet connection...",[]),
   39:     {ok,_} = ct_telnet:open(?name),
   40:     ct:log("...done",[]),
   41:     Config.
   42: 
   43: end_per_testcase(_,_Config) ->
   44:     ct:log("end_per_testcase: closing telnet connection...",[]),
   45:     _ = ct_telnet:close(?name),
   46:     ct:log("...done",[]),
   47:     ok.
   48: 
   49: 
   50: %% OTP-10648
   51: %% This test case should fail with timetrap timeout.
   52: %%
   53: %% The long timetrap timeout and timeout option in the expect call
   54: %% also causes the telnet client to hang so long that the attempt at
   55: %% closing it (in end_per_testcase) will time out (close timeout is 5
   56: %% sec) without a timetrap timeout occurring in end_per_testcase.
   57: %%
   58: %% The point is to see that the connection is thoroughly removed and
   59: %% unregistered anyway so that the next test case can successfully
   60: %% open a connection with the same name.
   61: %%
   62: %% Note!!! that if end_per_testcase reaches a timetrap timeout before
   63: %% the connection is closed, then the connection will survive until
   64: %% the hanging expect times out, after which it will be closed in a
   65: %% seemingly normal way due to the close message which was sent by the
   66: %% close attempt. This could happen any time during the subsequent
   67: %% test cases and cause confusion... There is however not much to do
   68: %% about this, except writing test cases with timetrap timeout longer
   69: %% than the close timeout (as this test case does)
   70: expect_timetrap(_) ->
   71:     {error,timeout} = ct_telnet:expect(?name, ["ayt"], [{timeout,20000}]),
   72:     ok.
   73: 
   74: %% This should succeed
   75: expect_success(_) ->
   76:     ok = ct_telnet:send(?name, "echo ayt"),
   77:     {ok,["ayt"]} = ct_telnet:expect(?name, ["ayt"]),
   78:     ok.
